ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend it for a really solid grounding in galaxy formation theory, but it does take more work than other classes.
"It's about the theories surrounding galaxy formation." I would recommend it because I learned a lot.

If my fellow student is interested in cosmology, he should definitely consider taking this course. It's the type of course that you learn a great deal after the suffering (there are courses that you don't learn as much after the suffering). The lecture slides are also very useful. I keep going back to refer to them when I read other literature.Astro 610 is a very rewarding experience for me personally.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Gave me a strong, in depth introduction to galaxy formation, which I'm glad I know.
I have a better sense of the big picture of today's cosmology research after taking the course. I haven't started dissertation research yet, but this course prepares me for reading astro papers.
